Posts.Content: Hi all, my boyfriend has metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer, stage 4. He has been on zytiga for 4 months and it is not working. He is 47. They now what to start chemo, taxotere, for 12 cycles. Has anyone done this chemo? How do you feel afterwards. He is tired now and he will be treated every 3 weeks. Very frustrated with this disease. Has anyone gone on disability for it. He is considering it. Thanks for any info.
Posts.Title: chemo for prostate cancer

Posts.Content: Thank you mkane09. Will check out all your great info. Prayers and luck to you too.
Posts.Title: chemo for prostate cancer

Posts.Content: Hi Rlyons, My boyfriend is currently on Lupron and hates it. He is finishing up chemo in a month and was thinking about going off Lupron at the same time. My question is what is considered intermittent Lupron treatments? How long and how much. Thank you very much and best of luck to you. His PSA is 45 and only has two more chemo treatments left.

Posts.Content: Lancepeace, Thanks for the reply. I was just looking at Xofigo/radium 223 today. Will now check out Cometrig. Thanks again.
Posts.Title: Extreme bone pain for two weeks now

Posts.Content: Hi All, My boyfriend has metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer. He is only 48. He has done provenge, zytiga, taxotere. All failed. Doctor wants to start him on Xtandi. He has just started experiencing extreme bone pain in his neck, shoulders, back and his left leg and hip. After reading SE of Xtandi, he doesn't want more pain. Would rather have quality of life over quantity at this point. He takes Oxycotone for pain and is up to a pill (5/325) every 4 or 5 hours now. Also lots of fatigue. Any suggestions for pain alleviation? Very open to holistic suggestions as well. Thank you and prayers for all on this site.
Posts.Title: Extreme bone pain for two weeks now
Extreme bone pain for two weeks now

Posts.Content: Yes, he is being treated for metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer. It is very aggressive and he is only 47. The headaches have not let up yet. Worried that if he feels this bad, he won't continue with chemo. We see his doctor on Wed for a zometa treatment. Will ask doctor then. Thanks for replying.
Posts.Title: Headaches?

Posts.Content: My boyfriend just started Chemo 3 days ago. He is getting really bad headaches. Anyone have any suggestions to relieve them? Thanks.
